<s>[INST] What is Listeria infection, and what causes it? [/INST] Listeria infection, also known as listeriosis, is caused by Listeria monocytogenes bacteria, often contracted from contaminated food. </s>

<s>[INST] Who is at an increased risk of Listeria infection? [/INST] People at greater risk include pregnant women and their unborn or newborn babies, individuals with weakened immune systems due to chronic illnesses like cancer or diabetes, and those taking medications that impair immunity. </s>

<s>[INST] How do Listeria bacteria differ from other bacteria that cause foodborne illnesses? [/INST] Listeria bacteria are unique in that they can grow and thrive in low-temperature environments, making refrigeration crucial in preventing their growth. </s>

<s>[INST] How can individuals ensure that their hands, knives, and chopping boards are properly cleaned when handling raw foods? [/INST] Proper cleaning with warm, soapy water before and after handling raw foods is essential to prevent contamination. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some common sources of Listeria contamination in fruits and vegetables? [/INST] Listeria bacteria can be found on fruit and vegetables grown in soil, so proper washing before consumption is vital. </s>

<s>[INST] What is meningococcal disease? [/INST] Meningococcal disease is a rare but life-threatening bacterial infection.</s>
<s>[INST] How should meningococcal disease be treated? [/INST] Antibiotic treatment in the hospital is essential for anyone with meningococcal disease.</s>
<s>[INST] Who is most at risk of developing meningococcal disease in WA? [/INST] Children up to 5 years old have the highest risk of developing meningococcal disease in WA.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the symptoms of meningococcal disease in babies? [/INST] Symptoms in babies may include fever, rapid breathing, vomiting, irritability, lethargy, and unusual crying or moaning.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the symptoms of meningococcal disease in older children and adults? [/INST] Symptoms in older children and adults may include fever, headache, vomiting, diarrhea, neck stiffness, muscle or joint pains, and drowsiness or confusion.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the appearance of the rash associated with meningococcal disease? [/INST] The rash looks like small bleeding points beneath the skin or bruises.</s>
<s>[INST] How is meningococcal disease diagnosed? [/INST] Diagnosis can be difficult at the start of the illness, and monitoring symptoms is important.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the transmission method of meningococcal bacteria? [/INST] Meningococcal bacteria are spread by respiratory secretions, such as coughing, sneezing, or kissing.</s>
<s>[INST] How common is meningococcal disease in WA? [/INST] On average, there are between 10 and 20 cases of meningococcal disease in WA each year, mainly in winter and spring.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the different serogroups of meningococcal bacteria? [/INST] There are 13 different types of meningococcal bacteria, with serogroups A, B, C, Y, and W being the most common worldwide.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the death rate associated with Men W infections? [/INST] Men W has twice the death rate of other strains of meningococcal disease.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the time frame for the development of meningococcal disease? [/INST] Meningococcal disease usually takes 3 to 4 days to develop but can take as long as 10 days.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the long-term outcome for most people with meningococcal disease? [/INST] Most people with meningococcal disease make a full recovery, but about 10 percent may suffer long-term disability.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the primary mode of spread for meningococcal bacteria? [/INST] Meningococcal bacteria are primarily spread through respiratory secretions and close contact.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the treatment protocol for meningococcal disease? [/INST] Antibiotic treatment in the hospital is essential, and early treatment increases the likelihood of a full recovery.</s>

<s>[INST] Who are considered very close contacts at high risk of meningococcal disease? [/INST] Very close contacts include household members, sexual contacts, children in the same child care group for more than 4 continuous hours, and attendees of parties, pubs, or nightclubs.</s>

<s>[INST] What is contact tracing in relation to meningococcal disease? [/INST] Public Health Unit staff conduct contact tracing to identify and assess individuals who may have been exposed to meningococcal cases.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the vaccination recommendation for meningococcal disease in children aged 12 months? [/INST] A combined meningococcal vaccine is offered for free to children aged 12 months, with catch-up programs for other age groups.</s>
<s>[INST] Is there a meningococcal B vaccine recommendation? [/INST] A meningococcal B vaccine is recommended for Aboriginal children and medically at-risk children up to the age of two.</s>
<s>[INST] Are vaccines available against different serogroups of meningococcal bacteria? [/INST] Vaccines are available against meningococcal serogroups A, B, C, W, and Y.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the recommended vaccination for people traveling to high-risk areas? [/INST] The combined meningococcal vaccine is recommended for people traveling to high-risk areas, but it may not be funded.</s>
<s>[INST] Where can people get more information about vaccination? [/INST] People can contact their local immunization provider, public health unit, or GP for vaccination information.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the contact details for population/public health units? [/INST] Contact details for population/public health units can be obtained through healthcare professionals.</s>
<s>[INST] What should you do if you suspect meningococcal disease? [/INST] Seek medical advice early if you or your child shows symptoms of meningococcal disease.</s>

<s>[INST] What is schizophrenia? [/INST] Schizophrenia is a severe mental disorder that affects about 1 percent of the general population.</s>

<s>[INST] How does schizophrenia affect a person's life? [/INST] Schizophrenia can disrupt a person's work, education, and daily life, making it difficult to care for themselves and take on responsibilities.</s>

<s>[INST] What role do families and friends play in caring for individuals with schizophrenia? [/INST] Families, friends, and other carers play a crucial role in helping care for people with schizophrenia.</s>
<s>[INST] Is it possible to lead a productive life with schizophrenia? [/INST] Yes, it is possible to lead a productive and meaningful life with schizophrenia.</s>

<s>[INST] What are some other diagnoses that share symptoms with schizophrenia? [/INST] Mood disorders like bipolar disorder, major depression, personality disorder, and post-traumatic stress disorder share some symptoms with schizophrenia.</s>

<s>[INST] Do specialists believe that schizophrenia might actually be different conditions that overlap? [/INST] Yes, specialists now believe that schizophrenia might involve different conditions that overlap.</s>
<s>[INST] How can schizophrenia be diagnosed? [/INST] Schizophrenia can be diagnosed based on the symptoms a person is currently experiencing.</s>
<s>[INST] When do symptoms of schizophrenia usually start? [/INST] Symptoms of schizophrenia typically start between 16 and 30 years of age.</s>

<s>[INST] What factors are associated with an increased risk of schizophrenia? [/INST] Factors like a family history of schizophrenia, drug use (cannabis and amphetamines), and stressful life events are associated with an increased risk of schizophrenia.</s>
<s>[INST] What are hallucinations? [/INST] Hallucinations are experiences where a person hears, sees, feels, or smells things that others do not, even when there is no one there.</s>

<s>[INST] What are delusions in the context of schizophrenia? [/INST] Delusions in schizophrenia refer to strong beliefs that most other people would not share, such as beliefs in conspiracies or persecution.</s>

<s>[INST] What is thought disorder in schizophrenia? [/INST] Thought disorder in schizophrenia is when everyday thoughts become jumbled and confused, making sentences unclear or hard to understand.</s>

<s>[INST] Can thoughts seem to speed up or slow down in schizophrenia? [/INST] Yes, in schizophrenia, thoughts can seem to speed up or slow down, and people may feel like thoughts are being inserted or removed from their minds.</s>

<s>[INST] What are negative symptoms in schizophrenia? [/INST] Negative symptoms in schizophrenia include problems falling asleep, loss of energy, poor concentration, and a lack of motivation or pleasure in everyday life.</s>

<s>[INST] How are strong emotions and feelings related to schizophrenia? [/INST] People with schizophrenia can experience strong emotions like being upset, anxious, confused, depressed, or overwhelmed.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the recommended treatment for schizophrenia? [/INST] Treatment for schizophrenia typically involves a combination of antipsychotic medications and psycho-social treatments.</s>

<s>[INST] What are antipsychotic medications used for in schizophrenia treatment? [/INST] Antipsychotic medications can help manage the symptoms of schizophrenia, but they may also have side effects.</s>

<s>[INST] What are 'talking' therapies in schizophrenia treatment? [/INST] 'Talking' therapies in schizophrenia treatment include psychological support, counseling, and sessions with a psychologist, which can help people manage their symptoms and negative thoughts.</s>

<s>[INST] What is cognitive-behavior therapy (CBT) used for in schizophrenia treatment? [/INST] CBT is used to help people with schizophrenia manage negative thoughts, anxiety, depression, and develop coping strategies.</s>

<s>[INST] How can family intervention therapies help in schizophrenia treatment? [/INST] Family intervention therapies can help families better understand the disorder and develop better communication and problem-solving skills.</s>

<s>[INST] How do psychosocial treatments and psychological treatments help people with schizophrenia? [/INST] Psychosocial treatments help with everyday challenges, while psychological treatments help individuals understand their symptoms and adjust to living with schizophrenia.</s>

<s>[INST] What reduces the likelihood of relapses in individuals with schizophrenia? [/INST] People who receive multiple treatment types are less likely to have relapses, and a well-organized system of support from friends, family, and professionals is effective in managing the illness.</s>

<s>[INST] What are some everyday strategies for coping with hallucinations in schizophrenia? [/INST] Everyday strategies for coping with hallucinations include connecting with others with similar experiences and finding meaning and purpose in life.</s>

<s>[INST] How can family and friends support individuals with schizophrenia? [/INST] Family and friends can support individuals with schizophrenia by accepting their experiences, showing love and support, and encouraging them to describe their experiences.</s>
<s>[INST] Where can people seek help for schizophrenia? [/INST] People can seek help for schizophrenia from their GP, psychiatric services, or mental health emergency response lines.</s>
<s>[INST] What is Healthdirect Australia's contact number for seeking help with schizophrenia? [/INST] Healthdirect Australia can be reached at 1800 022 222 for seeking help with schizophrenia.</s>

<s>[INST] What is RuralLink's contact number for seeking help with schizophrenia in rural and remote areas? [/INST] RuralLink can be reached at 1800 552 002 for seeking help with schizophrenia in rural and remote areas.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the Mental Health Emergency Response Line's contact number for seeking help with schizophrenia? [/INST] The Mental Health Emergency Response Line can be reached at 1300 555 788 for Perth metro callers and 1800 676 822 for Peel callers.</s>

<s>[INST] Can mosquito-borne diseases have long-term health effects on survivors? [/INST] Some survivors may experience long-term neurological effects, but these are relatively rare. </s>

<s>[INST] Are there any specific recommendations for travelers with pre-existing medical conditions regarding mosquito-borne diseases? [/INST] Travelers with medical conditions should consult their healthcare provider for personalized advice and may need extra precautions. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the economic costs associated with mosquito-borne diseases in Australia? [/INST] The economic costs can be substantial due to healthcare expenses, lost productivity, and mosquito control efforts. </s>

<s>[INST] How do climate and environmental changes impact the prevalence of mosquito-borne diseases? [/INST] Climate and environmental changes can influence mosquito populations, their distribution, and the timing of disease outbreaks. </s>
<s>[INST] Can mosquito-borne diseases like MVE and Kunjin virus be eradicated? [/INST] Eradication is challenging, but control measures can significantly reduce their impact and risk. </s>

<s>[INST] What role can individuals play in supporting mosquito control efforts in their communities? [/INST] Individuals can support efforts by eliminating breeding sites, reporting mosquito problems, and following public health recommendations. </s>

<s>[INST] How can travelers stay informed about mosquito-borne diseases when planning trips to affected areas? [/INST] Travelers should consult local health authorities, the CDC, WHO, and travel advisories for up-to-date information before their trips. </s>

<s>[INST] Can mosquito-borne diseases become a global health threat? [/INST] While they are primarily regional threats, factors like climate change and increased global travel can pose challenges. </s>

<s>[INST] How do researchers track and monitor the spread of mosquito-borne diseases? [/INST] Researchers use a combination of mosquito surveillance, virus testing, and epidemiological data to monitor and track the spread of these diseases. </s>

<s>[INST] Can individuals who have recovered from MVE or Kunjin virus infections donate blood? [/INST] Donors who have recovered from these infections should consult with blood donation centers and follow their guidelines. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the impact of mosquito-borne diseases on tourism in affected areas? [/INST] The impact can be significant, as outbreaks may deter tourists, affecting local economies. </s>

<s>[INST] Can travelers returning from mosquito-borne disease-affected areas pose a risk to their communities? [/INST] Travelers who are infected can potentially infect local mosquitoes, but the risk is generally low in non-endemic areas. </s>

<s>[INST] Can mosquitoes develop resistance to insecticides used in mosquito control programs? [/INST] Yes, mosquitoes can develop resistance to insecticides over time, which underscores the need for integrated control strategies. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some ongoing research priorities in the field of mosquito-borne diseases? [/INST] Research priorities include understanding virus transmission dynamics, developing effective vaccines, and improving mosquito control methods. </s>

<s>[INST] What are Ross River virus (RRV) and Barmah Forest virus (BFV)? [/INST] Ross River virus (RRV) and Barmah Forest virus (BFV) are the two most common mosquito-borne viruses in Western Australia and can cause severe symptoms in people. </s>

<s>[INST] How do you catch RRV and BFV viruses? [/INST] People can only catch these viruses after being bitten by an infected mosquito. RRV and BFV cannot be caught from direct contact with another person or animal. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the incubation period for RRV and BFV? [/INST] For both viruses, the time between being bitten and becoming sick (the incubation period) is normally 7 to 14 days. It can vary, however, from as little as 3 days to up to 3 weeks. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the common symptoms of RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] Symptoms common to both viruses include painful and/or swollen joints, sore muscles, aching tendons, skin rashes, fever, tiredness, headaches, and swollen lymph nodes. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the less common symptoms of RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] Less common symptoms include sore eyes, sore throat, nausea, and tingling in the palms of the hands or soles of the feet. </s>
<s>[INST] How long do fever, nausea, and skin rashes typically last in RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] Fever, nausea, and skin rashes usually disappear within the first 2 weeks of illness. </s>
<s>[INST] What can be done to ease joint pain and swelling in RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] Medical treatments focus on easing joint pain and swelling and minimizing fatigue. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the recommended treatment for joint pain in RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] For some people, simple painkillers such as aspirin or paracetamol are sufficient. Others require stronger medications to ease the inflammation. </s>
<s>[INST] How can emotional stress and physical fatigue affect RRV and BFV symptoms? [/INST] Emotional stress and physical fatigue may cause symptoms to worsen or last longer. </s>
<s>[INST] Is there a vaccine available to prevent RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] There are no registered vaccines to prevent RRV or BFV. </s>
<s>[INST] How can people protect themselves against RRV and BFV viruses? [/INST] The best protection against RRV and BFV diseases is to minimize the risk of being bitten by an infected mosquito. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some tips to avoid mosquito bites and reduce the risk of contracting RRV or BFV? [/INST] Tips include insect-proofing houses, avoiding outdoor activities during peak mosquito activity, wearing protective clothing, and using mosquito repellents. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the most effective mosquito repellents? [/INST] The most effective repellents contain either diethyl toluamide (DEET) or picaridin. Lotion or gel repellents are the most effective. </s>

<s>[INST] How can young children be protected against RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] The best protection for babies and young children is protective clothing, bed nets, and other forms of insect screening. </s>

<s>[INST] What can be done to reduce mosquito breeding habitats? [/INST] Dispose of all containers that hold water, stock ornamental ponds with mosquito-eating fish, and keep swimming pools well chlorinated and free of dead leaves. </s>

<s>[INST] How can mosquito-proof covers be used to prevent mosquito breeding? [/INST] Fit mosquito-proof covers to vent pipes on septic tank systems. Seal all gaps around the lid and ensure leach drains are completely covered. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some broader mosquito control measures in place? [/INST] Many local governments conduct mosquito control programs in some of the worst mosquito breeding areas with assistance from the Department of Health. </s>

<s>[INST] How can individuals protect themselves against mosquito-borne diseases while traveling? [/INST] If you are traveling, discuss with your GP how to protect yourself against diseases carried by mosquitoes. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the risk of RRV and BFV in different regions of Western Australia? [/INST] RRV and BFV can occur anywhere in Western Australia when conditions are warm enough for the viruses to be active and wet enough for mosquito breeding. </s>

<s>[INST] When is RRV most active in the southern half of WA? [/INST] RRV is most active between September and May, especially when above-average rainfall or unusually high tides create large mosquito breeding habitats. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the area of greatest risk for RRV and BFV in the southern half of WA? [/INST] In the southern half of WA, the coastal plain between Mandurah and Busselton is the area of greatest risk during spring and summer. </s>
<s>[INST] What are some recommendations for reducing the risk of RRV and BFV near wetlands? [/INST] People living near wetlands should take particular care to avoid mosquito bites. </s>

<s>[INST] How often should pot plant drip trays be emptied and cleaned to prevent mosquito breeding? [/INST] Pot plant drip trays should be emptied once a week or filled with sand to prevent mosquito breeding. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the recommended control method for reducing mosquitoes? [/INST] Residual chemical sprays can be used to further reduce mosquitoes, but this should not replace the removal and prevention of backyard breeding sites. </s>
<s>[INST] How can the public get more information about RRV and BFV diagnoses, treatment, and support? [/INST] For further information, people can contact Arthritis and Osteoporosis WA. </s>
<s>[INST] Is there a specific medical cure for RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] There is no specific medical cure for RRV or BFV. </s>

<s>[INST] What should a doctor do if they diagnose a patient with RRV or BFV? [/INST] A doctor who diagnoses RRV or BFV in a patient must notify the Department of Health so more can be understood about where the viruses are active. </s>
<s>[INST] What long-term effects may be associated with RRV and BFV diseases? [/INST] Research into the long-term effects of both viruses is still being conducted. </s>

<s>[INST] Can people catch RRV and BFV viruses again after recovery? [/INST] Most people who have been infected with RRV or BFV will not catch the same virus in the future, but in rare cases, people may experience one or more symptoms after apparent recovery. </s>
<s>[INST] How do RRV and BFV viruses spread in nature? [/INST] In nature, RRV and BFV are passed back and forth between animals and mosquitoes. </s>
<s>[INST] What are the symptoms of RRV and BFV diseases in children? [/INST] Symptoms tend to be milder in children, and the illness often doesn't last as long. </s>
<s>[INST] What can be done to prevent mosquito-borne diseases in outdoor areas? [/INST] In high-risk areas, build a fully screened outdoor area to protect yourself when outside. </s>

<s>[INST] How should people time their outdoor activities to avoid mosquito activity? [/INST] Reduce the risk of contracting RRV or BFV by timing outdoor activities to avoid periods of greatest mosquito activity, particularly around dawn and dusk. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of the Department of Health in managing RRV and BFV cases? [/INST] The Department of Health should be notified by doctors diagnosing RRV or BFV so that public health action can be taken if necessary, including implementing mosquito control programs and issuing public warnings. </s>
<s>[INST] What should be done with containers that hold water to prevent mosquito breeding? [/INST] All containers that hold water should be disposed of to prevent mosquito breeding. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the risk of RRV and BFV viruses during and after the northern wet season in WA? [/INST] Generally, the risk of both viruses is greater during and just after the northern wet season, which is roughly December to June. </s>
<s>[INST] What should be done to keep swimming pools free of mosquitoes? [/INST] Keep swimming pools well chlorinated, filtered, and free of dead leaves to prevent mosquitoes from breeding. </s>

<s>[INST] What should be done with rainwater tanks to prevent mosquito breeding? [/INST] Rainwater tanks should be screened with insect-proof mesh, including inlet, overflow, and inspection ports. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the best protection for babies and young children against mosquito bites? [/INST] The best protection for babies and young children is protective clothing, bed nets, and other forms of insect screening. Only infant-strength repellents should be used on young children. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the risk of RRV and BFV viruses in the northern half of WA? [/INST] In the northern half of WA, RRV and BFV can be active anytime during the year when heavy rainfall or unusually high tides occur. </s>

<s>[INST] How can people recognize and avoid areas of mosquito activity? [/INST] People should recognize and avoid areas of mosquito activity, such as swamps, salt marshes, billabongs, and river floodplains. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the relationship between heavy rainfall and mosquito activity in WA? [/INST] Heavy rainfall or unusually high tides create large mosquito breeding habitats in WA, increasing the risk of mosquito-borne diseases. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some environmental factors that increase the risk of RRV and BFV in WA? [/INST] People living within three kilometers of salt marshes, brackish wetlands, and freshwater wetlands are at greater risk of contracting RRV and BFV diseases. </s>

<s>[INST] How can vegetation near wetlands affect the risk of RRV and BFV? [/INST] People living near wetlands should take particular care to avoid mosquito bites and be aware of the increased risk in these areas. </s>
<s>[INST] What should be done to keep swimming pools mosquito-free? [/INST] Keep swimming pools well chlorinated, filtered, and free of dead leaves to prevent mosquito breeding. </s>

<s>[INST] How can mosquito-proof covers be used to protect against mosquito-borne diseases? [/INST] Fit mosquito-proof covers to vent pipes on septic tank systems. Seal all gaps around the lid and ensure leach drains are completely covered. </s>

<s>[INST] What are some tips for reducing mosquito breeding sites around the home? [/INST] Empty pot plant drip trays once a week or fill them with sand. Empty and clean animal and pet drinking water bowls once a week. </s>

<s>[INST] How can residual chemical sprays be used to reduce mosquitoes? [/INST] Residual chemical sprays can be used to further reduce mosquitoes, but this should not replace the removal and prevention of backyard breeding sites, which is a more effective control method. </s>

<s>[INST] How can individuals seek further information about RRV and BFV diagnoses, treatment, and support groups? [/INST] For more information, individuals can contact Arthritis and Osteoporosis WA. </s>
<s>[INST] What should individuals do to get well after being infected with RRV or BFV? [/INST] Individuals should always keep in mind that they will get well. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of public health action when RRV or BFV is diagnosed in a patient? [/INST] Public health action may include implementing mosquito control programs and issuing public warnings. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the role of mosquito-eating fish in reducing mosquito breeding? [/INST] Stock ornamental ponds with mosquito-eating fish such as goldfish to help reduce mosquito breeding. </s>

<s>[INST] What can be done to reduce the risk of mosquito bites outdoors? [/INST] Cover up with long, loose-fitting, and preferably light-colored clothing to reduce the risk of mosquito bites outdoors. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the importance of screening doors and windows in high-risk areas? [/INST] In high-risk areas, it is important to screen all doors and windows to prevent mosquito entry. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the recommended timing for outdoor activities to avoid mosquito activity? [/INST] Reduce the risk of contracting RRV or BFV by timing outdoor activities to avoid periods of greatest mosquito activity, particularly around dawn and dusk. </s>

<s>[INST] How can mosquito repellents be used effectively? [/INST] When outdoors, carry an effective mosquito repellent for use if mosquitoes are active. The most effective repellents contain either diethyl toluamide (DEET) or picaridin. </s>

<s>[INST] What is yellow fever? [/INST] Yellow fever is a viral haemorrhagic disease transmitted by mosquitoes.</s>
<s>[INST] What causes the skin to turn yellow in yellow fever? [/INST] In serious cases, jaundice causes the skin to turn yellow in yellow fever.</s>
<s>[INST] How can yellow fever be prevented? [/INST] Yellow fever can be prevented through immunization.</s>
<s>[INST] In which regions is yellow fever considered endemic? [/INST] Yellow fever is considered endemic in 30 African and 13 Central and South American countries.</s>
<s>[INST] How long does it take for yellow fever symptoms to appear? [/INST] Yellow fever symptoms usually appear 3 to 6 days after infection.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the initial symptoms of yellow fever? [/INST] The initial symptoms of yellow fever include fever, muscle pain, nausea, vomiting, headache, and weakness.</s>

<s>[INST] What percentage of people with yellow fever progress to a toxic stage, and what can happen during this stage? [/INST] Around 15 to 25 percent of those with yellow fever progress to a toxic stage, which can involve visible bleeding, jaundice, kidney, and liver failure.</s>
<s>[INST] How is yellow fever transmitted to humans? [/INST] Yellow fever is transmitted to humans by the bite of infected mosquitoes, primarily Aedes and Haemagogus species.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the two forms of yellow fever, and what causes them? [/INST] Yellow fever occurs in two forms, urban (household) and sylvatic (jungle), both caused by the same virus.</s>

<s>[INST] Where does sylvatic or jungle yellow fever occur? [/INST] Sylvatic or jungle yellow fever occurs in tropical rainforests, where infected monkeys transmit the virus to other mosquitoes that bite humans entering the forest.</s>
<s>[INST] Who is most at risk of contracting yellow fever? [/INST] People who travel to high-risk areas, such as Africa and South America, are most at risk of contracting yellow fever.</s>
<s>[INST] What organization provides a list of yellow fever declared places? [/INST] The World Health Organization (WHO) provides a list of yellow fever declared places.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the recommended age for yellow fever vaccination? [/INST] Yellow fever vaccination is recommended from 9 months of age.</s>

<s>[INST] How long does the yellow fever vaccine provide protection for the majority of people? [/INST] For the majority of people, a single dose of yellow fever vaccine provides life-long immunity.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the effectiveness of yellow fever vaccine in terms of protection? [/INST] The vaccine offers 90 percent protection in 14 days and almost 100 percent protection in 28 days.</s>
<s>[INST] When is vaccination recommended for travelers? [/INST] Vaccination is recommended for all travelers to countries or areas with a high risk of yellow fever transmission.</s>

<s>[INST] What precautions should travelers take in high-risk areas to avoid mosquito bites? [/INST] Travelers in high-risk areas should wear mosquito repellent, light-colored, long-sleeved clothes, and avoid wearing perfume or cologne.</s>

<s>[INST] What should travelers do to prevent mosquitoes from entering their accommodation in high-risk areas? [/INST] Travelers should keep doors/fly screens closed and use a mosquito net at night if mosquitoes are likely to be present.</s>
<s>[INST] How is yellow fever diagnosed? [/INST] Yellow fever is diagnosed through a blood test.</s>
<s>[INST] Why is yellow fever considered a notifiable disease? [/INST] Yellow fever is a notifiable disease to ensure that health authorities are informed of cases for public health monitoring.</s>

<s>[INST] What actions are taken by health authorities when yellow fever is diagnosed? [/INST] Health authorities may inquire about travel history and advise patients on necessary precautions such as staying away from work or school.</s>
<s>[INST] Is there a specific treatment for yellow fever? [/INST] There is no specific treatment for yellow fever, but medicines can be used to relieve symptoms and may improve outcomes.</s>

<s>[INST] Where should individuals go for help if they suspect yellow fever symptoms after traveling to a high-risk country? [/INST] Individuals should see their doctor or go to their local hospital for evaluation.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the period of protection for yellow fever vaccine? [/INST] The period of protection for yellow fever vaccine has changed from 10 years to the duration of the vaccinated person's life.</s>
<s>[INST] Is yellow fever vaccination recommended for pregnant women? [/INST] Yellow fever vaccination is not recommended for pregnant women.</s>
<s>[INST] Are there any exceptions to yellow fever vaccination recommendations? [/INST] Vaccination is not recommended when traveling to areas with low risk of exposure to yellow fever.</s>

<s>[INST] Who should avoid yellow fever vaccination due to known anaphylaxis to eggs? [/INST] People with known anaphylaxis (severe allergic reaction) to eggs should avoid yellow fever vaccination.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the activity period of mosquitoes that transmit yellow fever? [/INST] The mosquitoes that transmit yellow fever are usually active during the day.</s>

<s>[INST] What measures can travelers take to prevent mosquito bites while in high-risk areas? [/INST] Travelers can wear mosquito repellent, long-sleeved clothes, avoid perfume or cologne, and use mosquito nets at night.</s>

<s>[INST] Where can individuals get help for yellow fever-related concerns? [/INST] Individuals can see their doctor, contact their local Public Health Unit, or call healthdirect on 1800 022 222 for help.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the latest update regarding high-risk countries for yellow fever? [/INST] The latest updates on high-risk countries can be checked with the World Health Organization (WHO).</s>

<s>[INST] What are some related topics to consider when traveling overseas? [/INST] Related topics include infectious diseases found overseas, planning travel, medical costs overseas, mosquito-borne diseases, and preventing mosquito bites on holiday overseas.</s>
<s>[INST] Are there specific vaccination centers for yellow fever? [/INST] Yes, there are yellow fever vaccination centers where individuals can receive the vaccine.</s>

<s>[INST] Where can individuals find more information on yellow fever? [/INST] Additional information on yellow fever can be found on the websites of the Australian Department of Health, Centre for Disease Control and Prevention, and the World Health Organization.</s>
<s>[INST] Can yellow fever be transmitted from person to person? [/INST] No, yellow fever is not transmitted from person to person; it is primarily transmitted by mosquitoes.</s>

<s>[INST] What percentage of people with yellow fever die during the second 'toxic' stage? [/INST] Approximately half of those who progress to the second 'toxic' stage of yellow fever die within 10 to 14 days after the onset of illness.</s>

<s>[INST] How can one differentiate between urban and sylvatic forms of yellow fever? [/INST] The urban form of yellow fever occurs in households, while the sylvatic form occurs in jungle or forested areas.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the most effective way to protect against yellow fever in high-risk areas? [/INST] The most effective way to protect against yellow fever in high-risk areas is through vaccination.</s>
<s>[INST] Are there any travel restrictions associated with yellow fever vaccination? [/INST] Some countries may require travelers to provide evidence of yellow fever vaccination before entry.</s>
<s>[INST] Is yellow fever vaccination recommended for children under 9 months of age? [/INST] Yellow fever vaccination is not recommended for children under 9 months of age.</s>

<s>[INST] Are there any side effects associated with yellow fever vaccination? [/INST] Yellow fever vaccination can have mild side effects such as fever or soreness at the injection site, but serious side effects are rare.</s>

<s>[INST] What should individuals do if they experience yellow fever symptoms after traveling to a high-risk country? [/INST] Individuals should seek medical attention promptly if they suspect yellow fever symptoms after travel.</s>

<s>[INST] Is yellow fever vaccination recommended for individuals with weakened immune systems? [/INST] Yellow fever vaccination may not be recommended for individuals with weakened immune systems; they should consult their healthcare provider.</s>

<s>[INST] What measures can travelers take to minimize their risk of contracting yellow fever? [/INST] Travelers can reduce their risk by getting vaccinated, wearing protective clothing, and using mosquito repellent.</s>

<s>[INST] How is yellow fever transmission different in urban and sylvatic settings? [/INST] In urban settings, yellow fever is transmitted from mosquitoes to humans directly. In sylvatic settings, it involves infected monkeys and forest mosquitoes.</s>

<s>[INST] Is yellow fever vaccination mandatory for all travelers to high-risk areas? [/INST] Yellow fever vaccination is not mandatory for all travelers, but it is highly recommended for their protection.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the importance of checking the list of yellow fever vaccination centers? [/INST] Checking the list helps individuals find the nearest vaccination center for convenience.</s>
<s>[INST] Is there a specific timeframe for yellow fever vaccination before travel? [/INST] It is recommended to get vaccinated at least 10 days before traveling to allow for immunity to develop.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the primary reason for avoiding perfume or cologne in high-risk areas? [/INST] Perfume or cologne can attract mosquitoes, increasing the risk of bites in high-risk areas.</s>
<s>[INST] How is the blood test used for yellow fever diagnosis conducted? [/INST] A blood test for yellow fever diagnosis involves analyzing a blood sample for the presence of the virus.</s>
<s>[INST] What is multiple sclerosis (MS)? [/INST] Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a chronic, neurodegenerative condition that affects the central nervous system (CNS).</s>
<s>[INST] How does MS affect the central nervous system (CNS)? [/INST] MS affects the central nervous system by causing inflammation and the development of lesions on the nerves.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the role of myelin in MS? [/INST] Myelin is a protective sheath of fatty protein that surrounds nerves in the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve, and it is attacked in MS.</s>
<s>[INST] What happens during an MS attack? [/INST] During an MS attack, inflammation occurs, and one or more lesions develop, leading to scarring (sclerotic plaque) on the nerves.</s>
<s>[INST] How does MS interfere with nerve messages in the CNS? [/INST] MS interferes with nerve messages in the CNS by disrupting the transmission of signals between the brain and spinal cord.</s>

<s>[INST] How many main types of MS are there? [/INST] There are 4 main types of MS: Relapsing-remitting MS (RRMS), Primary-progressive MS, Secondary-progressive MS (SPMS), and Progressive-relapsing MS.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the most common type of MS? [/INST] Relapsing-remitting MS (RRMS) is the most common type, initially diagnosed in approximately 85% of people with MS.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the gender ratio for MS? [/INST] MS affects more women than men at a ratio of 3:1.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the common signs and symptoms of MS? [/INST] Common signs and symptoms of MS include muscle weakness, tension, loss of balance, vision problems, fatigue, and pain.</s>
<s>[INST] Do symptoms of MS vary among individuals? [/INST] Yes, symptoms of MS vary among individuals, and the disease is unpredictable.</s>

<s>[INST] What determines the specific symptoms experienced by someone with MS? [/INST] The specific symptoms experienced by someone with MS depend on which part of the central nervous system is being affected at the time.</s>

<s>[INST] How is MS diagnosed? [/INST] MS is diagnosed through a comprehensive assessment of medical history, physical examination, and diagnostic tests such as magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and evoked potentials.</s>
<s>[INST] Is there a single definitive test for diagnosing MS? [/INST] No, there is no single definitive test for diagnosing MS; it involves a combination of assessments and tests.</s>
<s>[INST] What does an MRI scan reveal in MS diagnosis? [/INST] An MRI scan shows pictures of inflammation and areas of scar tissue in the central nervous system (CNS) of individuals with MS.</s>

<s>[INST] Are there other tests used in MS diagnosis besides MRI? [/INST] Yes, in some cases, evoked potentials (nerve transmission speed) and lumbar puncture (spinal tap) may be required for diagnosis.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the current understanding of what causes MS? [/INST] The exact cause of MS is unknown, but research focuses on genetics, exposure to the Epstein-Barr virus, lifestyle factors, and vitamin D as potential factors.</s>
<s>[INST] Is MS a contagious condition? [/INST] No, MS is not contagious and cannot be transmitted from person to person.</s>
<s>[INST] Does genetics play a role in who develops MS? [/INST] Genetics does play an important role in determining who is at risk of developing MS.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the goal of MS research efforts? [/INST] MS research aims to understand the cause of the disease and find a cure. It also focuses on developing treatments and support services for people with MS.</s>

<s>[INST] What treatments are available for relapsing-remitting MS (RRMS)? [/INST] Treatments for RRMS aim to reduce the number and severity of relapses and may include disease-modifying therapies (DMTs).</s>
<s>[INST] Is early treatment recommended for MS? [/INST] Yes, early treatment for MS is highly recommended, as it can reduce the long-term disability caused by the disease.</s>

<s>[INST] What are disease-modifying therapies (DMTs)? [/INST] Disease-modifying therapies (DMTs) are medications that decrease the frequency and severity of attacks or relapses and slow the progression of disability in relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis.</s>

<s>[INST] Are there DMTs available for all types of MS? [/INST] Currently, DMTs are available for the relapsing-remitting form of MS, but they do not appear to modify progressive forms of the disease.</s>

<s>[INST] Is it safe to use DMTs during pregnancy and breastfeeding? [/INST] There is limited research evidence regarding the safety of using DMTs during pregnancy and breastfeeding, so treatment is generally suspended during this time.</s>

<s>[INST] How should individuals with MS discuss treatment options with their healthcare providers? [/INST] Individuals with MS should discuss their treatment options and questions thoroughly with their neurologist.</s>

<s>[INST] Where can individuals with MS find support and information? [/INST] Individuals with MS can find support and information from organizations like the Multiple Sclerosis Society of Western Australia (MSWA).</s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of genetics in MS research? [/INST] Genetics plays a role in MS research as scientists investigate the genetic factors that may contribute to the development of the disease.</s>
<s>[INST] How does exposure to the Epstein-Barr virus relate to MS research? [/INST] Researchers study the potential link between exposure to the Epstein-Barr virus and the development of MS.</s>
<s>[INST] What lifestyle factors are examined in MS research? [/INST] Lifestyle factors, such as diet and physical activity, are explored in MS research to understand their impact on the disease.</s>
<s>[INST] Why is vitamin D a focus of MS research? [/INST] Vitamin D is studied in MS research because it may have a role in the development and progression of the disease.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the goal of the Multiple Sclerosis Society of Western Australia (MSWA)? [/INST] MSWA supports people living with MS by providing services, funding research, and building high-support accommodation and respite facilities.</s>
<s>[INST] Is there a cure for MS? [/INST] There is currently no cure for MS, but research efforts aim to find a cure in the future.</s>
<s>[INST] How common is MS among young adults? [/INST] MS is the most common degenerative neurological condition diagnosed in young adults, particularly those aged 20 to 40.</s>
<s>[INST] Can MS be prevented? [/INST] MS cannot be prevented, but research is ongoing to understand its causes and risk factors.</s>

<s>[INST] Are there specific demographics that are more at risk of developing MS? [/INST] Genetics and gender are factors that influence the risk of developing MS, with women being more commonly affected.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the mission of the MSWA Nursing Team? [/INST] The MSWA Nursing Team provides information about MS treatments and helps manage side effects for individuals using disease-modifying therapies (DMTs).</s>

<s>[INST] How can individuals find a GP or doctor for MS-related concerns? [/INST] Individuals can search for a GP or doctor through various resources, including online directories and health services.</s>

<s>[INST] What is pneumonia?[/INST] Pneumonia is a bacterial or viral infection in your lungs. It can cause mild to severe illness in people of all ages.</s>

<s>[INST] What age groups are most vulnerable to pneumonia?[/INST] Pneumonia can affect people of all ages, but babies, young children, and the elderly are more vulnerable.</s>

<s>[INST] What causes Q fever? [/INST] Q fever is caused by infection with the Coxiella burnetii bacteria.</s>

<s>[INST] How is Q fever transmitted to humans? [/INST] Q fever can be spread to humans from infected animals by breathing in airborne droplets of their urine, milk, faeces, or birth products that contain the bacteria.</s>
<s>[INST] Which animals can spread Q fever to humans? [/INST] Sheep, cattle, goats, cats, dogs, bandicoots, feral rodents, kangaroos, birds, and ticks can all spread Q fever to humans.</s>
<s>[INST] Can Q fever be transmitted through drinking unpasteurized milk? [/INST] Yes, it is possible to get Q fever by drinking unpasteurized milk from an infected animal.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the occupations at increased risk of Q fever? [/INST] Occupations at increased risk include abattoir and meat processing workers, veterinarians, pelt and hide tanners, professional shooters, sheep shearers, and sheep, cattle, and dairy farmers.</s>
<s>[INST] Is vaccination recommended for those at risk of Q fever? [/INST] Yes, it is recommended that all people working in high-risk occupations consider vaccination against Q fever.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the common symptoms of Q fever? [/INST] Common symptoms of Q fever include fever, chills, headaches, sweating, muscle aches, general fatigue, and body weakness.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the potential long-term complications of untreated Q fever? [/INST] Untreated Q fever can lead to long-term complications such as pneumonia, hepatitis, and endocarditis, which is a life-threatening heart valve infection.</s>

<s>[INST] Is Q fever a notifiable disease? [/INST] Yes, Q fever is a notifiable disease, and doctors, hospitals, and laboratories must inform the Department of Health of a diagnosis. Notification is confidential.</s>

<s>[INST] What are rabies and lyssavirus? [/INST] Rabies virus and Australian bat lyssavirus (ABLV) belong to a group of viruses called lyssaviruses.</s>
<s>[INST] Is there a treatment for rabies once symptoms have started? [/INST] No, there is no available treatment for rabies once symptoms have started.</s>
<s>[INST] How can you protect against the rabies virus and other lyssaviruses? [/INST] A vaccine is available and used to protect against the rabies virus and other lyssaviruses, including ABLV.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the early symptoms of rabies? [/INST] The early symptoms of rabies include flu-like symptoms such as headache, fever, and fatigue.</s>

<s>[INST] How does rabies progress if left untreated? [/INST] Rabies can progress rapidly to paralysis, delirium, and convulsions, and death can occur within a week or two of the onset of illness.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the variability in the time it takes for symptoms to appear after exposure to an infected animal? [/INST] There is a wide variability in the time it takes for symptoms to appear following exposure to an infected animal, ranging from several days to several years.</s>

<s>[INST] How is the Rabies virus spread to humans? [/INST] The Rabies virus is spread from infected animals to people through bites or scratches, or by being exposed to infected animals' saliva through the eyes, nose, or mouth.</s>

<s>[INST] Which animals can transmit rabies overseas? [/INST] Overseas, dogs are the main transmitter of rabies. Other animals that transmit rabies overseas include bats, monkeys, foxes, cats, raccoons, skunks, jackals, and mongooses.</s>

<s>[INST] In Australia, which animals are known to carry ABLV? [/INST] In Australia, evidence of ABLV infection has been found in various species of flying foxes/fruit bats and insect-eating micro bats. It is assumed that any bat in Australia could potentially carry ABLV.</s>

<s>[INST] Does the behavior or appearance of a bat indicate whether it is carrying the virus? [/INST] No, the behavior or appearance of a bat is not an accurate guide as to whether it is carrying the virus.</s>

<s>[INST] Can contact or exposure to bat faeces, urine, or blood pose a risk of exposure to lyssaviruses? [/INST] No, contact or exposure to bat (or other animal) faeces, urine, or blood does not pose a risk of exposure to lyssaviruses.</s>

<s>[INST] Have any wild or domestic animals in Australia been found to be infected with ABLV? [/INST] Apart from two horses, no wild or domestic animals in Australia have ever been found to be infected with ABLV.</s>

<s>[INST] Who is at increased risk of contracting rabies? [/INST] People who handle bats in Australia or overseas, and people who come into contact with wild or domestic land dwelling mammals (e.g., dogs) in a country where there is a rabies risk, are at increased risk of contracting rabies.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the best protection against being exposed to rabies or other lyssaviruses? [/INST] The best protection is to avoid handling any bat in Australia or overseas, or any wild or domestic land dwelling mammal (e.g., dogs, cats) in a country where there is a rabies risk.</s>

<s>[INST] Who should handle bats or flying foxes? [/INST] Only people who have been vaccinated against rabies and who have been trained in the care of bats should ever handle bats or flying foxes.</s>

<s>[INST] What should you do if you come across an injured bat? [/INST] Anyone who comes across an injured bat should contact the relevant state government authority or a local wildlife care group or rescuer for assistance. Do not touch the bat and avoid direct contact with any bat saliva.</s>

<s>[INST] How is rabies prevented through vaccination? [/INST] A Rabies vaccine is available and used to protect against the rabies virus and other lyssaviruses, including ABLV. It typically involves a series of either 4 or 5 rabies vaccine injections over 1 month.</s>
<s>[INST] Are periodic vaccine booster doses required for rabies protection? [/INST] Yes, periodic vaccine booster doses may also be required for continued rabies protection.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the complications of lyssaviruses? [/INST] Lyssaviruses can have serious complications, including death. These viruses affect the central nervous system and are usually fatal.</s>

<s>[INST] How many people die each year worldwide from infection with the rabies virus? [/INST] The World Health Organization estimates that more than 55,000 people die each year worldwide from infection with the rabies virus.</s>

<s>[INST] What should you do if you are bitten or scratched by a bat or land dwelling mammal? [/INST] If you are bitten or scratched by a bat anywhere in the world or by a land dwelling mammal overseas, you should immediately wash the wound thoroughly with soap and water for at least 5 minutes, apply an antiseptic with antivirus action, and seek medical attention as soon as possible to care for the wound and assess whether you are at risk of infection.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of rabies immunoglobulin in treatment? [/INST] If you are at risk of infection and have not been vaccinated previously, you will require an injection of rabies immunoglobulin as soon as possible as part of the treatment.</s>

<s>[INST] How many rabies vaccine injections are recommended for people at increased risk of being bitten or scratched by bats? [/INST] A course of three injections, given over 1 month, is recommended for people whose job or other activities place them at increased risk of being bitten or scratched by bats in Australia or overseas.</s>
<s>[INST] What if you have been vaccinated against rabies before? [/INST] Even if you have been vaccinated before, you will require 2 further doses of vaccine.</s>

<s>[INST] How is the diagnosis of lyssaviruses confirmed? [/INST] Diagnosis requires confirmation by laboratory tests for the presence of lyssaviruses in skin, blood, spinal fluid, and nervous tissue.</s>
<s>[INST] Can rabies be treated once symptoms have started? [/INST] No, there is no available treatment for rabies once symptoms have started.</s>

<s>[INST] How can you reduce the risk of infection if bitten or scratched by an animal? [/INST] Proper cleansing of the wound by washing it thoroughly with soap and water for at least 5 minutes can reduce the risk of infection.</s>

<s>[INST] What antiseptics with antivirus action can be applied to a wound after being bitten or scratched by an animal? [/INST] Antiseptics with antivirus action, such as povidone-iodine, iodine tincture, aqueous iodine solution, or alcohol (ethanol), can be applied to the wound after washing.</s>

<s>[INST] How is rabies treated if you have not been vaccinated previously and are at risk of infection? [/INST] If you have not been vaccinated previously and are at risk of infection, you will require an injection of rabies immunoglobulin as part of the treatment.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the availability of rabies immunoglobulin in overseas countries? [/INST] Rabies immunoglobulin is often difficult to obtain in overseas countries.</s>
<s>[INST] How is vaccination for rabies administered? [/INST] Vaccination includes a series of either 4 or 5 rabies vaccine injections over 1 month.</s>

<s>[INST] How should an injured bat be handled if found? [/INST] Anyone who comes across an injured bat should contact the relevant state government authority or a local wildlife care group or rescuer for assistance and should not touch the bat or have direct contact with its saliva.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the role of periodic vaccine booster doses for rabies protection? [/INST] Periodic vaccine booster doses may also be required to maintain rabies protection.</s>
<s>[INST] Are rabies and ABLV vaccines effective in preventing infection? [/INST] Yes, rabies and ABLV vaccines are effective in preventing infection if administered properly.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the estimated number of annual rabies deaths worldwide? [/INST] The estimated number of annual rabies deaths worldwide is more than 55,000, according to the World Health Organization.</s>

[/INST] If you are bitten or scratched by a bat anywhere in the world, immediately wash the wound thoroughly with soap and water, apply an antiseptic with antivirus action, and seek medical attention promptly.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the signs and symptoms of rabies? [/INST] The signs and symptoms of rabies include flu-like symptoms, headache, fever, fatigue, and rapid progression to paralysis, delirium, and convulsions.</s>

<s>[INST] How is rabies spread from infected animals to humans? [/INST] Rabies is spread from infected animals to humans through bites or scratches, or by being exposed to infected animals' saliva through the eyes, nose, or mouth.</s>

<s>[INST] What should you do if you come into contact with bat saliva? [/INST] If you come into contact with bat saliva, seek medical attention as soon as possible to assess whether you are at risk of infection.</s>

<s>[INST] What are Shiga toxin producing E. coli (STEC) and haemolytic uraemic syndrome (HUS)? [/INST] Escherichia coli (E. coli) are bacteria normally found in the gut and faeces (poo) of people and animals.</s>
<s>[INST] Who is at the greatest risk of developing STEC infection and HUS? [/INST] Children under 5 and the elderly are at greatest risk of developing this condition.</s>
<s>[INST] How can STEC infection be transmitted? [/INST] You become infected with STEC by ingesting the bacteria through your mouth.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the sources of STEC infection? [/INST] STEC is mainly found in the faeces of cows and sheep.</s>
<s>[INST] How can person-to-person spread of STEC infection occur? [/INST] Person-to-person spread can happen if you come into contact with microscopic amounts of faeces from an ill person.</s>
<s>[INST] What are the common symptoms of STEC infection? [/INST] Symptoms of STEC infection start between 1 to 10 days after you have ingested the bacteria and usually last for 5 to 7 days.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the signs and symptoms of HUS? [/INST] Signs and symptoms of HUS can include decreased urination, swelling of limbs, high blood pressure, jaundice, seizures, or bleeding into the skin.</s>
<s>[INST] How is STEC infection diagnosed? [/INST] Laboratory testing of a faecal specimen is necessary to confirm that symptoms are due to STEC infection.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the treatment for STEC infection? [/INST] People with confirmed or suspected STEC infection should drink plenty of fluids and avoid anti-vomiting or anti-diarrhoeal medications unless prescribed or recommended by a doctor.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the treatment for HUS? [/INST] People with confirmed or suspected HUS usually require hospitalization.</s>

<s>[INST] What precautions should be taken while having STEC infection? [/INST] Do not go to work or school for at least 24 hours after symptoms have finished, or 48 hours if you work in a high-risk setting.</s>
<s>[INST] How can the spread of STEC infection be prevented? [/INST] Avoid contact with people who have gastroenteritis symptoms and practice good hand hygiene.</s>

<s>[INST] What should you avoid when traveling to certain countries to prevent STEC infection? [/INST] When traveling to developing countries, especially in Asia, the Pacific islands, Africa, the Middle East, and Central and South America, you should avoid certain foods and beverages.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the importance of peeling fruit when traveling to prevent STEC infection? [/INST] Fruit that you peel yourself is usually safe when traveling.</s>
<s>[INST] How can you ensure safe drinking water when traveling to prevent STEC infection? [/INST] Use bottled water or disinfect water for drinking and brushing teeth.</s>
<s>[INST] Where can you find help for STEC infection? [/INST] Find a GP/doctor or visit healthdirect.</s>

<s>[INST] What are the potential complications of HUS? [/INST] HUS can lead to permanent kidney damage and death.</s>

<s>[INST] What is whooping cough? [/INST] Whooping cough is a highly infectious disease that can be life-threatening for babies and young children.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the characteristic whooping sound associated with in whooping cough? [/INST] The whooping sound is caused by a big gasping breath after coughing bouts.</s>

<s>[INST] How long does the cough last in whooping cough patients? [/INST] The cough may last up to 3 months, but the person is no longer infectious after 21 days (3 weeks).</s>

<s>[INST] How is whooping cough spread? [/INST] Whooping cough spreads by airborne droplets when an infectious person coughs bacteria into the air, which can then be inhaled by others in close proximity.</s>
<s>[INST] When are people with whooping cough no longer infectious after treatment? [/INST] After 5 days of antibiotic treatment, people with whooping cough are normally no longer infectious.</s>

<s>[INST] Who is most at risk of whooping cough? [/INST] People living in the same household as someone infected with whooping cough are especially at risk, and young unimmunized children are at the most risk of serious complications.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the recommended timing for pregnant women to receive the whooping cough vaccine? [/INST] It is recommended that pregnant women receive the whooping cough vaccine during the third trimester of pregnancy (between 28 and 32 weeks).</s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of booster injections in whooping cough prevention? [/INST] Booster injections are needed because vaccine immunity fades over time, so they provide continued protection against whooping cough.</s>

<s>[INST] How can the spread of whooping cough infection be minimized? [/INST] Teach children about cough and sneeze etiquette, such as coughing or sneezing into your elbow rather than your hand, and dispose of used tissues in a closed bin.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the treatment for whooping cough in young infants? [/INST] Young infants, especially those too young to have been immunized, may need treatment in intensive care in the hospital.</s>
<s>[INST] How is whooping cough treated with antibiotics? [/INST] Antibiotics are used in the early stages of illness and can help prevent the spread of whooping cough infection to others.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of health care and child care workers in whooping cough prevention? [/INST] Adults working with young children, especially health care and child care workers, are recommended to receive a booster for whooping cough.</s>
<s>[INST] Who is required to notify confirmed cases of whooping cough? [/INST] Doctors, hospitals, and laboratories must confidentially notify confirmed cases to the local Public Health Unit.</s>

<s>[INST] What can be done to restrict infectious children from going to pre-school and school? [/INST] Infectious children can be restricted from attending pre-school and school to prevent the spread of whooping cough.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of unimmunized contacts in child care during a whooping cough outbreak? [/INST] Unimmunized contacts may be excluded from child care unless they take the recommended antibiotics.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of the whooping cough vaccine in pregnancy? [/INST] The vaccine in pregnancy is more effective in reducing the risk of whooping cough in young infants than vaccinating the mother after the birth.</s>

<s>[INST] How does the whooping cough vaccine work? [/INST] The whooping cough vaccine provides good protection from infection and is delivered in one injection with diphtheria and tetanus (dTpa).</s>

<s>[INST] What is the childhood immunization schedule for whooping cough? [/INST] Babies need to be immunized at 6-8 weeks, 4 months, and 6 months to provide protection when they are most at risk of severe illness.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the recommended timing for a whooping cough booster for older children? [/INST] A whooping cough booster can be given from 3.5 years of age.</s>

<s>[INST] Where can parents check if their child has been vaccinated against whooping cough? [/INST] Parents can check their child's immunization record by speaking to their GP or contacting the Australian Childhood Immunization Register.</s>

<s>[INST] When is a booster for adults recommended for whooping cough? [/INST] A booster for adults is recommended if they have not had a pertussis vaccination in the past 10 years, when planning a pregnancy, or for other adult household members, grandparents, and carers of infants under 12 months of age.</s>

<s>[INST] What actions can help reduce the risk of whooping cough infection spreading through coughing or sneezing? [/INST] Teach children to cough or sneeze into their elbow rather than their hand, and dispose of used tissues in a closed bin.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the role of handwashing in preventing whooping cough infection? [/INST] Handwashing can help reduce the risk of infection spreading.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the purpose of Public Health Unit staff in whooping cough control? [/INST] Public Health Unit staff can provide advice about the best way to stop further spread of infection.</s>
<s>[INST] What is the importance of notifying confirmed cases of whooping cough? [/INST] Notifying confirmed cases is essential for monitoring and controlling the spread of the disease.</s>

<s>[INST] What is the role of antibiotics in preventing whooping cough infection in significant contacts? [/INST] Some babies and pregnant women may need antibiotics to prevent whooping cough infection if they have had significant contact with an infectious person.</s>

<s>[INST] What are some related topics to explore regarding whooping cough prevention and treatment? [/INST] Topics to explore include vaccines, vaccination safety, immunization records, and contact details for population/public health units.</s>
